title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 96.2 - Inspection of public documents
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 96.2 - Inspection of public documents

State Regulations

Copies of all registrations, filings and other documents filed with the Attorney

General and not exempt from disclosure pursuant to State or Federal law shall be open to public inspection subject to the following
requirements: (a) a request for inspection shall indicate the name and address of the person seeking the
inspection and shall be submitted in writing on form CHAR007 (Freedom of Information Law [FOIL] request form) to the New York State Attorney General, Charities Bureau, Attn: FOIL Officer, 28 Liberty Street, New York, NY 10005 or by e-mail to Charities. Via email portal as directed at
https://ag.ny.gov/bureau/foil or such other address or e-mail address as the Attorney General may designate; (b) such inspection shall be subject to the applicable provisions of article 6 of the Public Officers

Law; (c) such inspection shall at all times be subject to the supervision and control of the Attorney

General or the Attorney General's assistants; (d) the Attorney General is authorized to charge a
reasonable fee for copying and postage; and
(e) filings may be inspected, by prior appointment, at the
offices of the Charities Bureau during regular business hours or will be mailed or e-mailed to the requestor upon payment of all copying and postage
fees. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13
ยง
96.2

Amended

New York State Register July 3, 2018/Volume XL, Issue 27, eff. 7/3/2018

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
